dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.log
Class APIOperationStatus

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.lib2.util.OperationStatus
      dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.log.APIOperationStatus
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
EcuResourcesOperationStatus
public class APIOperationStatus
extends dreisoft.tresos.lib2.util.OperationStatus

This class is used as base class for OperationStati returned by usage of the tresos Public API. This class must not be overridden by hand but only via automatically created classes used for OperationStati and InvalidOperationExceptions.

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.a

APIOperationStatus

protected APIOperationStatus(java.lang.String code,
                             int severity,
                             java.lang.Object[] parameters,
                             boolean userStatus)
creates an instance of OperationStatus by defining a unique code, the severity-level and the parameters of this status

Parameters:
code - the unique code for this status
severity - the severity-level - see static final class-members
parameters - the parameters of this operationstatus
userStatus - a flag describing if this status is caused by the user or not (e.g. an error caused by the user)
Since:
2008.b

APIOperationStatus

protected APIOperationStatus(java.lang.String code,
                             int severity,
                             java.lang.Object[] parameters,
                             boolean userStatus,
                             java.util.Date timestamp)
Creates an instance of OperationStatus by defining a unique code, the severity-level and the parameters of this status. It is usually not necessary to call this constructor explicitly. In most cases you want to use getOkStatus().

Parameters:
code - the unique code for this status
severity - the severity-level - see static final class-members
parameters - the parameters of this operationstatus
userStatus - a flag describing if this status is caused by the user or not (e.g. an error caused by the user)
timestamp - a date value contining the creation date of this operation status
Since:
2008.b

Since:
2.0

printErrors

public void printErrors(int severityMask,
                        java.io.PrintStream errStream,
                        java.io.PrintStream outStream)
Print out messaged matching a given severity mask.

Parameters:
severityMask - to be built from SEVERITY_INFO|SEVERITY_WARNING|SEVERITY_ERROR
errStream - stream where errors and warnings are printed to
outStream - stream where info messages are printed to
Since:
2.0
